lines.line: Hello. What are you doing here?
We are the tower guards â€“ our business is our own!
You can't go up there. That's private, that is.
What's going on here?
You'll have to speak with the Watchtower Wizard about that.
Who are you? Are you one of the new guards?
No, I'm an adventurer.
Well what are you doing here?
Looking for adventures - what else?
Oh my, oh my! What does it all matter in the end, anyway?
What's the matter?
Oh dear, oh dear. Darn and drat!
We try hard to keep this town protected.
But how can we do that when the Watchtower isn't working?
What do you mean it isn't working?
The Watchtower here works by the power of magic. An ancient spell designed to ward off ogres that has been in place here for many moons.
The exact knowledge of the spell is lost to us now, but the essence of the spell has been infused into four powering crystals that keep the tower protected from the hordes in the Feldips.
So how come the spell doesn't work?
The crystals! The crystals have been taken!
Taken?
Stolen!
Stolen?
Yes, yes! Do I have to repeat myself?
Can I be of help?
Help? Oh wonderful, dear traveller!
Yes I could do with an extra pair of eyes here.
There must be some evidence of what has happened here. Perhaps you could assist me in searching for clues?
I would be happy to.
Try searching the surrounding area. If you find anything unusual, bring it here. Try the bushes - I've read enough adventure stories to know that clues get caught in bushes all the time.
I will tell the guards to let you past - that way, you can just use the ladder to get in and out.
I'm not interested.
That's typical, nowadays. It's left to us wizards to do all the work.
I'm not interested in your rantings.
Hmph! Suit yourself.
You wizards are always complaining.
Complaining? Complaining!
What folks these days don't realise is that if it weren't for us wizards, this entire world would be overrun with every creature you could possibly imagine. And some you couldn't even conceive of!
I've got some questions about the search for evidence.
Hello again. Did you find anything of interest?
No, sorry, nothing yet.
Oh dear, oh dear, there must be something, somewhere...
I have this...
Let me see...
No, sorry, this is not evidence. You need to keep searching, I'm afraid.
Have a look at these...
Interesting, very interesting.
Long nails...grey in colour...well chewed...
Of course! They belong to a skavid!
A skavid?
A servant race to the ogres: grey, depressed-looking creatures, always losing nails, teeth and hair!
They inhabit the caves in the Feldip Hills.
They normally keep to themselves, though. It's unusual for them to venture from their caves.
What do you suggest I do?
It's no good searching the caves. Well, not yet, anyway.
Why not?
They are deep and complex. The only way you will navigate the caves is to have a map or something.
It may be that the ogres have one...
And how do you know that?
Well... I don't.
So what do I do?
You need to be fearless and gain entrance to Gu'Tanoth, the city of the ogres, then find out how to navigate the caves.
That sounds scary...
Ogres are nasty creatures, yes. Only a strong warrior, and a clever one at that, can get the better of them.
What do I need to do to get into the city?
You'll need some way to make the guards let you in.
You could start by checking out the ogre settlements around here. Tribal ogres often dislike their neighbours... In the meantime, I'll throw those fingernails out for you.
I won't bother, then.
Won't bother? Won't bother!
Perhaps this quest is too hard for you?
Shall I search the caves?
Aha! A robe. This could be a clue...
Here's some armour; it could be evidence...
Aha, a dagger! I wonder if this is evidence...
I've found an eye patch; I had better show this to the Watchtower Wizard.
What's this? Disgusting! Some fingernails. They may be a clue though... I'd better take them.
I have already searched this place.
Hmmm, nothing here.
I've got some questions regarding the tribal ogres.
How's it going?
I am having difficulty with the tribes.
Talk to them face to face and don't show any fear. Make sure you are rested and well fed, and fight the good fight!
I have everything under control.
Good, good! I will expect the crystals back shortly then...
I have lost something the ogres gave to me.
Oh, deary me! Well, there's nothing I can do about it. You will have to go back to them, I'm afraid.
What do you want, small t'ing?
I seek entrance to the city of ogres.
Hahaha! You'll never get in there.
I'll find a way, trust me.
Bold words for a t'ing so small.
I could do something for you...
Hahaha! This creature t'inks it can help me! I would eat you now, but for your puny size.
Prove to me your might: bring me the bones of an adult dragon to chew on, and I'll eat them, not you.
Die, creature!
Hahaha! It t'inks it's a match for Toban, does it?
Hahaha! Small t'ing returns. Did you bring the dragon bone?
I don't have what you want.
Then you shall get nothing from me!
When I say I will get something, I get it!
Hahaha! Small t'ing has done it. Toban is glad - take this...
The small t'ing returns; what do you want now?
I seek another task.
Have you arrived for dinner? Hahaha! Be gone, small t'ing!
I can't find the relic part you gave me.
Small t'ing, you lie to me! I always says that small t'ings are big trouble.
I think I need a key of some sort.
Why you here, little t'ing?
You got no business there!
Just a minute... Maybe if you did somet'ing for me, I might help you get in.
What can I do to help an ogre?
South-east of here der is more ogres - the name of the chieftain is Toban. He stole gold from me and I want it back!
Here is a key to the chest it's in. If you bring it here, I may reward you...
I have come to kill you!
Kill me, eh? You shall be crushed. Guards!
Where my gold from dat dirty Toban?
Well, well, the little t'ing has got it! Take dis to show little t'ing is a friend to da ogres. Hahahahaha!
I have your gold.
No you don't! If you want to impress me, get da gold I asked for!
I haven't got it yet.
Don't come back until you have it, unless you wanna be on tonight's menu!
I have lost the key!
Stoopid! Take another and don't lose it!
Oh yeah? What's dat den?
Oh yeah, I've got it right here.
Stoopid!
Are you trying to trick me? I bet you got it stored somewhere. Humans always do that.
It's the little t'ing again.
Do you have any other tasks for me?
No, I have no more tasks for you, now go away.
I have lost the relic part you gave me.
Are you blind? I can see you got it even from here!
Grrr, why do I bother? It's a good job I got another part.
What do you want, little morsel? You would look good on my plate!
I want to enter the city of ogres.
Hah! I should eat you instead!
Don't eat me; I can help you.
What can a morsel like you do for me?
I am a mighty adventurer, slayer of monsters and user of magic powers.
Well, well, perhaps the morsel can help after all...
If you t'ink you're tough, find Gorad, my enemy to the south-east, and knock one of his teeth out! Heheheheh!
You will have to kill me first.
That's not tricky - guards!
The morsel is back. Does it have our tooth for us?
Err, I don't have it.
Morsel, you dare to return without the tooth! Either you are stoopid, or wants to be eaten!
I have it.
That'll annoy Gorad lots! Heheheheh! Here's a token of my gratitude: some old gem I stole from Gorad, and an old part of a statue.
I've come to knock your teeth out!
You shut your face! I smack you till you dead and sorry!
What are you doing here, morsel?
Can I do anything else for you?
I have nothing left for you but the cooking pot!
I've lost the relic part you gave me.
You lie to me, morsel!
Stupid morsel, I have another. Take it and go now before I lose my temper.
You probably got it stored somewhere, morsel! Humans do that a lot.
I've lost the crystal you gave me.
How dare you lie to me morsel! I will grind you up for my bread!
I suppose you want another? I suppose just this once I could give you my copy...
An ogre called Og gave me this...
An ogre called Grew gave me this...
An ogre called Toban gave me this...
Ah, it's part of an old ogre statue. I'll take that off you - it might come in handy if I can fix it up.
Ah, it's more of that old ogre statue. I'll take this bit too.
It looks like you've brought me all the pieces of the relic. It is as I thought - a statue symbolising an ogre warrior of old.
Well, if you ever want to make friends with an ogre, this is the item to have! Now I'll try to assemble it...
I've got some questions about the ogre city.
I had a feeling you might say that.
Ah, the warrior returns. Have you found a way into Gu'Tanoth yet?
I can't get past the guards.
Well, ogres dislike others apart from their own kind. What you need is some form of proof of friendship, something to trick them into believing you're their friend.
Which shouldn't be too hard, considering their intelligence.
I have lost the relic you gave me.
Have you gone mad? I can see you have it with you!
What? Lost the relic? How careless! It's a good job I copied its design, then! You can take this copy instead - it's just as good.
I imagine you've stored it somewhere. Go and see where you might have put it.
I will find my way in, no problem.
Yes, I'm sure you will... Good luck!
Stop, creature! Only ogres and their friends allowed in this city. Show me a sign of companionship, like a lost relic or somefing, and you may pass.
Until then, back to whence you came!
Well, what proof of friendship did you bring?
I have a relic!
It's got the statue of Dalgroth. Welcome to Gu'Tanoth, friend of the ogres.
I've made it into the ogre city!
It's like talking to a broken record.
How are you doing with the ogres?
I have gained entry to the city!
Already? Excellent!
I still can't navigate the skavid caves.
You need a map of some kind... I bet one of the ogres has one.
Okay thanks, I'll go and find out.
Oi! Where do you think you are going? You are for the cooking pot!
But I am a friend to ogres...
Prove it to us with a gift. Get us something from the market.
Like what?
Surprise us...
Not if I can help it.
You can help by being tonight's dinner, or you can go away. Now, which shall it be?
Okay, okay, I'm going.
Back to whence you came!
Grrrrr!
Um... is there anything in my backpack that you'd want?
You didn't bring anything! Shove off!
Stop, creature! Oh it's you. Well, what have you got for us, then?
How about this?
Well, well, look at this. My favourite: rock cake! Okay, we will let it through.
What do you want, small thing? Leave us alone!
Oi! Little thing. If you want to cross here, you must pay me 20 gold pieces first!
You want me to give you 20 gold pieces to let me jump off a bridge?
That's what I said, like it or lump it.
Okay, I'll pay it.
A wise choice, little thing.
And where is your money? Grrrr! Do you want to get hurt or something?
Phew! I just made it.
Forget it, I'm not paying.
In that case you're not crossing.
Grrrr, what business you got here?
I am on an errand.
So what you want with me?
I am an ogre killer come to destroy you!
I would like to see you try!
I seek passage into the skavid caves.
Is that so... You humour me small t'ing. Answer this riddle and I will help you...
I want you to bring me an item: I will give you all the letters of this item, you work out what it is...
My first is in days, but not in years, My second is in evil, and also in tears, My third is in all, but not in none, My fourth is in hot, but not in sun.
My fifth is in heaven, and also in hate, My sixth is in fearing, but not in fate, My seventh is in plush, but not in place.
My eighth is in nine, but not in eight, My last is in earth, and also in great.
My whole is an object, that magic will make. It brings wrack and ruin to all in its wake... Now how long, I wonder, will this riddle take?
Hur, hur, hur... I see you haven't worked it out yet. Keep trying, imp.
Can I hear the riddle again?
I'll be back!
That is not what I want, imp!
I worked it out!
Hur, hur. The imp has done it! This is what you be needing...
What is it?
Do you have any other riddles for me?
Yes, what looks good on a plate with salad?
I don't know...
You! Now go, and bother me no more.)
A nice pizza?
Grr! Think you are a comedian, eh? Get lost!
I have lost the map you gave me.
What's the point? Take this one and go away!
You imps always store things in places and forget. Go look for it.
Are you blind? What is that you are carrying?
Oh, that map...
I'm glad that was easier on the way back!
I've got some questions about the skavid caves.
Oh, really? I'm quite an expert on skavids.
Wonderful!
Only joking!
Okay, okay.
How is the quest going?
I have worked out the guard's puzzle.
My, my. A wordsmith as well as a hero.
I am still trying to navigate the skavid caves.
Take some illumination with you or else it will be dark.
I am trying to get into the shamans' cave.
Yes, it will be well guarded. Hmmm, let me see...
Ah yes, I gather some ogres are allergic to certain herbs. Now what was it? It had white berries and blue leaves....
Cave nightshade, that's it!
You should try looking through some of the caves.
Alright!
And don't forget to look out for the dragons!
The WHAT?
Dragons.
Didn't you know that the ogres keep blue dragons as pets and for magical ingredients?
Well, regardless, I'm sure a bold, brave adventurer such as yourself won't have any problems.
Great...
It is going well.
That's good to hear. We are much closer to fixing the tower now.
Tanath cur, tanath cur!
Don't hurt me, don't hurt me!
Stop moaning, creature. I know about you skavids - you serve those monsters, the ogres.
Please don't touch me!
You have something that belongs to me...
I don't have anything; please believe me!
Somehow, I find your words hard to believe.
I'm begging your kindness; I don't have it!
I don't believe you, hand it over!
Ahhhhh, help!
Oh great, I'm not getting anywhere.
Okay, okay, I'm not going to hurt you.
Thank you, kind.
I'll tells you where that things you wants is. The mad skavids have it in their cave in the city.
You will have to learn skavid, otherwise they will not talks to you. Here, I'll tell you what you need to know...
I cannot help you, but the others can. Let me tells you the most common skavid words: Ar, nod, gor, ig and cur. Those will gets you started.
Master, how are you doing learning our language?
I am studying the speech of your kind...
Bidith tanath...
Cur.
Cur, cur tanath!
Cur tanath!
Ar.
Cur bidith...
Ig.
Ig! Bidith ig!
Tanath gor...
Nod.
Nod, gor nod!
Master, my kinsmen tell me you have learned skavid. You should speak to the mad ones in their cave.
Gor nod...
Tanath.
Hehe! So you speak a little skavid, eh? I'll give you a prize for that!
The others are with the shamans in the enclave - you'll never get them back. They hid one in the sacred rock! Nothing can touch it now.
What, you gots the crystal...
But I've lost it!
Alright, take this one then...
You stored it somewhere maybe. Go away!
Oh, okay then.
You be on your way, then.
I have gained access to the skavid caves.
'You'll have to speak with the Watchtower Wizard about that.'
I'd get more help out of a-
What was that?
Nothing.
Hello again. How do you fare?
It goes well. I can now navigate the skavid caves.
That is good news. Let me know if you find anything of interest.
I had a crystal, but I lost it!
Oh no. Well, you had better go back there, then!
I am now ready for the shamans.
Remember all I told you. You must distract the guard somehow. Cave nightshade is what you are looking for - try searching the skavid caves for it.
This herb is very poisonous, however, so handle it with care. Also, be on your guard in that cave. Who knows what monsters may be in that awful place...
Didn't you know that the ogres keep blue dragons as pets and for magical ingredients
No you don't!
What do you want?
I want to go in there.
Oh you do, do you? How about 'no'?
I want to rid the world of ogres.
You dare mock me, creature!
What is this? Arrrrgh! I cannot stand this plant! Argh, it burns! It burns!
Grrr! Go away from me, vermin!
Grr! How dare you talk to us. We will destroy you!
The shamans are too powerful for me to attack!
I have found the cave of ogre shaman, but I cannot touch them!
That is because of their magical powers. We must fight them with their own methods; do not speak to them! I suggest a potion...
Collect a guam leaf, add jangerberries, then mix in some ground bat bones. You must return it to me before you use it, so that I can empower it with my magic.
Be very careful how you mix it as it is extremely volatile. Mixing ingredients of this type in the wrong order can cause explosions!
I hope you've been brushing up Herblore and Magic? I must warn you, only experienced magicians can use the potion. It is too dangerous in the hands of the unskilled.
Any more news?
Can you tell me again what I need for the potion?
Yes indeed, let me see, what was it again...
You will need a guam leaf. That goes into the mix first.
What is the next ingredient?
You need some jangerberries.
I have some of those.
Wonderful!
You will need to add those after the guam leaf has gone in, but before the final ingredient.
What is the final ingredient?
The final ingredient is ground bat bones.
I have some bat bones; how can I grind them?
A pestle and mortar will more than do the trick.
When you have mixed the potion correctly, then I can empower the potion with magic and the ogre shamans can be destroyed.
No, I'm still working on it.
Any chance of advice about this potion?
Nope. Try the Watchtower Wizard.
I have made the potion.
That's great news; let me infuse it with magic...
Here it is - a dangerous substance. I must remind you that this potion can only be used if your Magic level is high enough.
How high is high enough?
Well, if you can cast Bones to Bananas, or any spells beyond that, you should be alright.
That's one destroyed...
That's the second one gone...
There goes the fourth...
That's five! Only one more left now...
I already have this crystal. There is no benefit to getting another.
Hello again. Did the potion work?
Indeed it did! I wiped out those ogre shamans!
I had another crystal but I lost it.
Oh, really? If you got it from someone, maybe they'll have found it again. Otherwise, go and search the place where you got it in the first place.
I am looking for another crystal.
I am sure the cave holds the final crystal. Look for the source of the shamans' power.
Okay, I will go and have a look.
I have found another crystal!
Good, hand it over to me.
Any chance of a hand?
Well, you could ask the Watchtower Wizard for one.
Magnificent! At last you've brought all the crystals.
Now the shield generator can be activated and, once again, Yanille will be safe from the threat of the ogres.
Put the crystals on the pillars there and throw the lever to activate the system.
The system is not activated yet. Throw the switch to start it.
What should I do now?
You will need to speak to the Watchtower Wizard.
Seriously, he's the one in charge here.
Marvellous! It works! The town will now be safe. Take these coins as a token of my gratitude. Also, let me improve your Magic level.
I've given you a special scroll too - it's a new spell. Read the scroll and you will be able to teleport yourself here.
Greetings, friend. I trust all is well with you? Yanille is safe at last!
Do you have any more quests for me?
More quests? No, indeed, adventurer. You have done us a great service, already.
I lost the scroll you gave me.
Never mind, have another...
Ho, ho, ho! A comedian to the finish. There it is, in your backpack!
That's okay.
We are always in your debt; do come and visit us again.
All's well that ends well.

characters.name: City guard
characters.description: Deep, rumbling male voice with a brutish ogre accent, slow and deliberate speech, condescending and menacing tone, enjoys riddles but speaks with crude grammar.

characters.name: Enclave guard
characters.description: Deep, gravelly male voice with an aggressive ogre accent, hostile and territorial tone, speaks curtly with threatening undertones.

characters.name: Gorad
characters.description: Very deep, slow male voice with a brutish ogre accent, dim-witted and aggressive tone, speaks simply with poor grammar and quick to anger.

characters.name: Grew
characters.description: Deep, menacing male voice with an ogre accent, cunning and petty tone, speaks with cruel amusement and refers to humans as morsels.

characters.name: Mad skavid
characters.description: High-pitched, erratic male voice, frantic and unstable tone with nervous laughter, speaks in broken sentences mixing skavid language with common tongue.

characters.name: Og
characters.description: Deep male voice with an ogre accent, more articulate than typical ogres, demanding and impatient tone, speaks with crude authority.

characters.name: Ogre chieftain
characters.description: Very deep, commanding male voice with a harsh ogre accent, aggressive and dismissive tone, speaks with brutal authority.

characters.name: Ogre guard
characters.description: Deep, gruff male voice with an ogre accent, demanding and threatening tone, speaks curtly with crude grammar, quick to resort to violence.

characters.name: Ogre shaman
characters.description: Deep, resonant male voice with mystical undertones, arrogant and superior tone, speaks with deliberate menace and magical authority.

characters.name: Scared skavid
characters.description: High-pitched, trembling male voice, fearful and submissive tone, speaks nervously with pleading desperation, mixing broken common tongue with skavid phrases.

characters.name: Skavid
characters.description: High-pitched, meek male voice, cautious and guarded tone, speaks mostly in skavid language with simple, hesitant responses.

characters.name: Toban
characters.description: Very deep, booming male voice with a harsh ogre accent, arrogant and mocking tone, speaks with cruel laughter and refers to humans as small things.

characters.name: Tower guard
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, firm and professional tone, a dutiful guard who takes his protective duties seriously.

characters.name: Watchtower Wizard
characters.description: Elderly male, refined British accent, anxious and flustered tone, an accomplished but worried mage who speaks with scholarly vocabulary and occasional dramatic exclamations.

characters.name: Watchtower wizard
characters.description: Elderly male, refined British accent, anxious and flustered tone, an accomplished but worried mage who speaks with scholarly vocabulary and occasional dramatic exclamations.

characters.name: Wizard
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, unhelpful and dismissive tone, a subordinate wizard who constantly defers questions to the Watchtower Wizard.
